required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: CD19-CAR-T Cells in Patients With R/R B-ALL
clinical_study.official_title: Phase I Study of the Safety and Efficacy of CD19-CAR-T Cells in Patients With Relapsed or Refractory Acute B-cell Lymphoblastic Leukemia (R/R B-ALL)

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single center, single arm, open-lable phase 1 study to determine the safety and efficacy of autologous or donor-derived allogeneic T cells expressing CD19 chimeric antigen receptors (referred to as "CD19-CAR-T cells") in patients with relapsed or refractory acute B-cell lymphoblastic leukemia (R/R B-ALL).

detailed_description.textblock:
Primary objective:
To investigate the safety and efficacy of autologous or HLA-haploidentical Allo-CD19-CAR-T cells in the treatment of patients with relapsed or refractory acute B-cell lymphoblastic leukemia.
Secondary objective:
To Assess the patient's quality of life after receiving the treatment.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Day90 after the CD19-CAR-T cell infusion
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants who achieved complete remission (CR) over all participants (CRR). The percentage of participants who achieved partial remission (PR) over all participants (PRR).

secondary_outcome.measure: The amount of CAR-T cells remaining in vivo
The lifetime of CAR-T cells remaining in vivo

arm_group.description: Subjects will receive CD19-CAR-T Cells on Day 0 : 100% of total dose.

intervention.description: T cells purified from the PBMC of subjects or subjects' relatives which depends on their conditions, transduced with 4-1BB/CD3-ζ lentiviral vector, expanded in vitro for future administration.
